intro: Raspalia teres, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of Central and South America. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Raspalia teres is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields due to its adaptability and rapid growth. Its hairy leaves and showy flowers make it both a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native range.
